comments.commentBody: Wow, a flashback to the old, thoughtful incarnation, the guy whose writing snagged a profile. A refreshing, welcome change.
"Despite the intimidation, we stood strong "  AKA citizens exercising their 1st amendment rights.

The Soros-funded rent-a-mobs? I was out at the Women's March, along with 100,000 of my fellow Minnesotans, and I didn't know it was a paying job.

Perhaps Eric knows where I should send my time slip.

Governor Walker, first of all, majority of American people didn't vote for DJT, and majority of you were not elected on your own merits. And second of all, without Koch brothers' money, most of you, would not be in the position you are now. We, in the state of Colorado, have an honorable governor, who happens to be a democrat, and was elected by the people, and without the help of big money. No one is demonstrating against him because he is keeping his promises to people and owes no one else anything, unlike the republican elected officials.

As people are realizing that they fell for a bunch of empty promises, you will see more demonstrations and uprising, 2018 isn't that far away, and we will see changes.

Please, NYTimes and other liberal media, don't give these conservatives a platform.  Political differences are not settled anymore over a glass of bourbon and branch water at the "Board of Education", or even a back slapping chat after hours between Johnson and Dirksen.  We are in a fight for the life of our nation.  So stiffen your spine.  Shrink their stage.  Stop trying to be "fair".  The only "fair" is to beat them back.

Governor--perhaps, instead, the republican pols might heed the case of King Canute in standing strong against the tide. He had the good sense to retreat.

'Will the advancing waves obey me, Bishop, if I make the sign?'
Said the Bishop, bowing lowly, 'Land and sea, my lord, are thine.'
Canute turned towards the ocean—'Back!' he said, 'thou foaming brine.

'From the sacred shore I stand on, I command thee to retreat;
Venture not, thou stormy rebel, to approach thy master's seat:
Ocean, be thou still! I bid thee come not nearer to my feet!'

But the sullen ocean answered with a louder, deeper roar...

---Wm Makepeace Thackeray, 'King Canute'

Sounds like your ideal would be for your home state (Wisconsin currently) to succeed from the USA so that it doesn't send any of its money to Washington.  But you might find even Republican voters don't agree and protest.  However your opinion is to ignore the protesting voters.
Leave it to a Koch puppet like Walker to advocate ignoring the will of the people.
Article should be titled: "Against the people, Republicans must stand strong".

We'll see where Republican thinking is if/when entitlements are states responsibility and Mississippi and Louisiana that take more from the federal treasury than many blue states need their medicaid/medicare.  Catch up red America, you got ketchup on your face.

Looks like the NYTimes readers are not buying it Scotty. Wisconsin has given the nation Paul Ryan, Scott Walker, and Reince Priebus and not one good idea has come from any of them. What ever happened to people like Bill Proxmire and Les Aspin. I apologize to the nation for Wisconsin's recent swap creatures.
Maybe such goals should be archived.

You want to get to work? How about you get the FBI to investigate Trump's business interests? If there's no entanglement with foreign powers, then the american mind will be set at ease.

Clearly his notion that he can let the kids run the candy store while he plays demigod is an inadequate response.

But you're right on one point, Mr. Walker: The GOP has to figure out how to contain this spinmeister. He is opposed to every single thing the republicans have pushed for, since the time of Reagan.
Afraid Oklahoma is in the same boat as Kansas.  The sad part is that Scott Walker is not deceptive--he really believes the 1% lies he spouts.
Paul Ryan, Reince Priebus, Scott Walker!  This is what happens when you drink the manure-tainted water of Wisconsin.  They look alike, they think alike.  It's getting hard to breathe in Wisconsin.

Leave it up to the states? Gag! That tired, old argument was historically proven to be just a smoke screen for any irrational, exclusionary, or cruel treatment to human beings throughout the U.S. existence.

Walker has also historically proven himself to be a wacko...a nutcase that should be selling used cars somewhere in rural Wisconsin.

Gov. Walker, we insist you act in the best interests of Americans and defy these protesters. Do not be intimidated by the Liberal Editors, Americans have many news sources such as Vox to unravel the bias at the Times and CNN.

Trump is a threat to political correctness and the fake news in way they have never seen before, and they will try to fight back. Ignore all the trust fund liberals and look out for the future generations. We are counting on you.
Wow! Maybe there is something to fake news... after all the NYT gave a platform to Scott Walker and presented the rubbish coming out of his eating hole as if it were news.
Where are we when impassioned support sounds like tongue-in-cheek?
Someone please help me figure out where do all these selfish, arrogant, and hypocrite conservatives come from and how they became so?

Len,

If Governor Dayton's Progressive Policies are the reason for Minnesota's success why did Republicans increase their control of the legislature in the recent election to both houses?

You might want to take a look at what the new Republican legislature wants to accomplish this session the "T" word is right up there at the top of the list that "T" would be for tax cuts!

I applaud you Gov. Walker for stating your case so clearly. It rings hollow however when viewed from the perspective of you and your republican colleagues' largely uncritical support for Donald Trump. That support was given enthusiastically and apparently blindly because republicans, again, put ideology before public service. The fact that your man in the White House is destroying our country means nothing to you, The fact that he was apparently elected with the help of Putin means nothing to you. You would like to see power shifted from federal to state control. The only thing keeping you and some of your fellow republicans from blowing this country up is federal oversight. I think Mr. Walker that you will be defined by your president Trump, I think you will not be in office much longer. I think history will look on you and your republican colleagues as the aberrations who came close to destroying democracy.
Try working with your fellow countrymen, Mr. Walker, instead of grandstanding and playing political games.

Wow. An impassioned defense of ignoring your own voters at town hall meetings?

Really?

Seems this idea of protesting one's election loss changes the outcome has become a movement.  Just because a loser protests the winner doesn't mean the loser's vote should have a mulligan.   If the protesters were the ones who voted for the winner, they should not be ignored.  But that is not the case here, all the protesters are the voters who voted for the loser, and they don't get a do over.  Representatives do well to not act on protests from the losers.
Scott Walker on the high road. That is rich.

In the beginning of this nation, our founding fathers were deeply divided on the question of state autonomy versus a centralized federalist government. In the end, our founding fathers collectively sought to make this country as strong as was possible to protect the nation from invasion and dissolution by uniting the states under a centralized federal government - so as to preserve this country as a haven for freedom and democracy in this world. That is how this nation was formed.

In truth, Walker only wishes to decentralize this country now because he and his party are in control of the State of Wisconsin. He wishes to seize this opportunity to return government control to himself as Governor, in complete opposition to the Founders intent. To be free as ruler to undermine democratic opposition and liberate moneyed benefactors to give money freely so that government and laws may be shaped to their wishes and they be allowed to monopolize and pollute at will. And so Walker himself may be free to be enriched and pursue happiness in a manner deserved by a man of his office and station. To hell with the rest of you all. Winners rule, that's why losers are losers. Takers - Take a hike!

We have morphed from a nation built by Founding Fathers to a nation controlled by Funding Fathers. Walker is a complete anathema to the core foundations of this nation and intents of our forefathers. Scott - you are the supreme taker. Where is this man's shame?
My Dear Mr ChristoFrey ... Allow me to suggest that you read and reflect on the Tenth Amendment to the U.S. Consitution.

As far as I knew our troops in South Korea are to deter aggression by the North Koreans and that is how they're positioned. The troops are so few they hardly pose a threat to China. In fact, there serve more as a tripwire.
